text:
Created attachment 24977
take care of WSAEISCONN

Unix's apr_socket_connect() takes care of EISCONN and returns APR_SUCCESS in case of EISCONN.
For compatibility with this, Window's apr_socket_connect() should take care of WSAEISCONN.

I will attach the patch.
creator: inoue@ariel-networks.com
trawick@apache.org
text:
FWIW, I am working with a patch which covers this issue as well.  Hopefully I can get it committed soon-ish.

I've rearranged the network_io/win32 apr_socket_connect() to closely match the network_io/unix version, and in the process picked up a couple of lines of code to handle EISCONN and a getpeername() optimization.

fixed in trunk r1089031
I'll make a note to see about backporting to 1.x after the upcoming 1.4.3 release
creator: trawick@apache.org
